summary: Edited 11/27/18: The person is no longer @rory.mccann.fever, they have changed their name to @got.the.hound.rory.mccann. They...
body:
An update on the Instagram drama


Edited 11/27/18: The person is no longer @rory.mccann.fever, they have changed their name to @got.the.hound.rory.mccann. They continue to taunt and harass other Rory/Sandor accounts.

————————————

First, a brief summary. The user @rory.mccann.fever started an Instagram account and filled it with post after post of photos from other sources, without asking permission or giving credit to the original source. Sadly, it goes further than just pics from pro photographers. She has also posted personal snapshots, fan art, image edits that were done by other people, and more. Most of the images came from pages and websites belonging to beloved members of the Sansan fandom.

When the error of her ways was brought to her attention, her response was to delete comments and/or block anyone who told her she was wrong. She continued stealing and posting content, and several Sandor/Hound/Sansan accounts closed up shop in order to protect themselves.

Cut to today. This is her response, in writing, to being told once again that she was using content that was not hers and that she should at least credit the original source:

FUCK. HER. This was not a mistake or a misunderstanding. It was a blatant disregard for the work of others.

If you have an Instagram account, please make sure that you are not following this person. They are a parasite, and it would be best if everyone refused to feed them.

Thank you.

summary: What kind of relationship do you expect to see between Sansa and Harry? Will there be marriage?
question: What kind of relationship do you expect to see between Sansa and Harry? Will there be marriage?
answer:
Honestly I have reread Sansa’s WoW chapters. I don’t know if they could have a love marriage. Sansa has to pretend to be this savvy older girl in front of him and he’s so dismissive of her as a person because he thinks she’s a bastard. If he knew she was Sansa, he’d approach her differently which I think will happen when Sansa is exposed but Sansa will still remember how he behaved. This is not to say that they can’t have a lovely relationship. This is just how I see it happening initially unless George makes him a terrible human being.

Yes, they will marry after Sweet Robin is murdered. I don’t know about a bedding because Sansa has to deal with Littlefinger. Then she’ll want to go North when word of Stannis’ army reaches her. I’m 90% sure Harry is dying

title: 6SS - Sansa & Arya - Reunion
body:
Their reunion was quiet and full of calm for two people that had a lot to say to each other.

There was no reclamation, no demands, no screams, nothing, just calm and a warm embrace. The tears that fell were silent.

They both knew that they had a lot to say, they had parted in such a horrid way that it tore at both of them, they were family and they loved each other.

Their voices were quiet, full of grief and full of emotions, apologizing to one another for mistakes that happened, for the cruel things said, for actions taken and those that were not.

Life had been cruel to them, separating each other when they needed each other the most.

But now they were together, they were sisters who loved one another and nothing would ever tear them apart again.

summary: Do you think Sansa will be raped in twow?  Since GRRM kind of approved this disgraceful Ramsay plot, I'm worried
question: Do you think Sansa will be raped in twow?  Since GRRM kind of approved this disgraceful Ramsay plot, I'm worried
answer:
It’s possible. No one’s virginity is as highlighted as Sansa’s and to take it away in brutal fashion is George’s style but he did say he’d never write a rape as it happened and there’s only one POV chapter in the Vale and it’s Sansa. Personally I don’t think it will happen. I think Sansa’s third and last marriage in the books will happen towards the end of the series and that’s when she’ll have sex for the first time (which is icky since she’s 13-14 right now and she’ll be 15 then maybe).

As for GRRM approving the Ramsay mess, this is a guy who implied a young girl was raped by dogs in ADWD for shock value. He isn’t the feminist some people think that he is. He probably approved of the storyline because he thinks it’s important. As if Theon can’t regain his identity some other way, as if Jon’s death in the show didn’t have another cause, as if Stannis in the show rallied Northern Houses because the Boltons had Ned Stark’s daughter. You could replace Sansa with a slab of meat and it would have the same overall effect (except on Sansa’s mental health). I’m equally pissed at people who act like Sansa’s having the time of her life in the Vale. Littlefinger constantly sexually assaults her. She’s sexually abused in both storylines but one of them is so utterly needless.

blog.name: julibf
blog.title: A Song of Ice and Fire

summary: Sansa and the Blue Winter Rose
title: Sansa and the Blue Winter Rose
body:
The first time Jon Snow meets Ygritte on A Clash of Kings, chapter 51,  she tells him the story of Bael the Bard and the Blue Winter Rose:

“The Stark in Winterfell wanted Bael’s head, but never could take him, and the taste o’ failure galled him. One day in his bitterness he called Bael a craven who preyed only on the weak. When word o’ that got back, Bael vowed to teach the lord a lesson. So he scaled the Wall, skipped down the kingsroad, and walked into Winterfell one winter’s night with harp in hand, naming himself Sygerrik of Skagos. Sygerrik means ‘deceiver’ in the Old Tongue, that the First Men spoke, and the giants still speak.

"North or south, singers always find a ready welcome, so Bael ate at Lord Stark’s own table, and played for the lord in his high seat until half the night was gone. The old songs he played, and new ones he’d made himself, and he played and sang so well that when he was done, the lord offered to let him name his own reward. 'All I ask is a flower,’ Bael answered, 'the fairest flower that blooms in the gardens o’ Winterfell.’

 

"Now as it happened the winter roses had only then come into bloom, and no flower is so rare nor precious. So the Stark sent to his glass gardens and commanded that the most beautiful o’ the winter roses be plucked for the singer’s payment. And so it was done. But when morning come, the singer had vanished … and so had Lord Brandon’s maiden daughter. Her bed they found empty, but for the pale blue rose that Bael had left on the pillow where her head had lain.”

 

(Jon VI -  A Clash of Kings)

Right next in the following chapter 52, Sansa has her first flowering. Thats the chapter where Sansa gets her first period and is finally fit to bear children to the king.

“The blood is the seal of your womanhood. Lady Catelyn might have prepared you. You’ve had your first flowering, no more.” Sansa had never felt less flowery. “My lady mother told me, but I… I thought it would be different.”“Different how?”“I don’t know. Less… less messy, and more magical.” Queen Cersei laughed. "Wait until you birth a child, Sansa. A woman’s life is nine parts mess to one part magic, you’ll learn that soon enough… and the parts that look like magic often turn out to be messiest of all.” She took a sip of milk. “So now you are a woman. Do you have the least idea of what that means?” “It means that I am now fit to be wedded and bedded,” said Sansa, “and to bear children for the king.” …….

Do you want to be loved, Sansa?“ "Everyone wants to be loved.” “I see flowering hasn’t made you any brighter,” said Cersei. “Sansa, permit me to share a bit of womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. Love is poison. A sweet poison, yes, but it will kill you all the same.”

(Sansa IV - A Clash of Kings)

In the end of chapter Cersei warns Sansa about love and how dangerous it can be. The following chapter of the book is also JON VII. George really wanted us to picture Jon, Sansa and the Blue Winter Rose tale all together.

Less… less messy, and more magical.” Queen Cersei laughed. "Wait until you birth a child, Sansa. A woman’s life is nine parts mess to one part magic, you’ll learn that soon enough… and the parts that look like magic often turn out to be messiest of all.” She took a sip of milk. “So now you are a woman. Do you have the least idea of what that means?” “It means that I am now fit to be wedded and bedded,” said Sansa, “and to bear children for the king.” …….

Do you want to be loved, Sansa?“ "Everyone wants to be loved.” “I see flowering hasn’t made you any brighter,” said Cersei. “Sansa, permit me to share a bit of womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. Love is poison. A sweet poison, yes, but it will kill you all the same.”

(Sansa IV - A Clash of Kings)

In the end of chapter Cersei warns Sansa about love and how dangerous it can be. The following chapter of the book is also JON VII. George really wanted us to picture Jon, Sansa and the Blue Winter Rose tale all together.
trail.content:
The first time Jon Snow meets Ygritte on A Clash of Kings, chapter 51,  she tells him the story of Bael the Bard and the Blue Winter Rose:

“The Stark in Winterfell wanted Bael’s head, but never could take him, and the taste o’ failure galled him. One day in his bitterness he called Bael a craven who preyed only on the weak. When word o’ that got back, Bael vowed to teach the lord a lesson. So he scaled the Wall, skipped down the kingsroad, and walked into Winterfell one winter’s night with harp in hand, naming himself Sygerrik of Skagos. Sygerrik means ‘deceiver’ in the Old Tongue, that the First Men spoke, and the giants still speak.

"North or south, singers always find a ready welcome, so Bael ate at Lord Stark’s own table, and played for the lord in his high seat until half the night was gone. The old songs he played, and new ones he’d made himself, and he played and sang so well that when he was done, the lord offered to let him name his own reward. 'All I ask is a flower,’ Bael answered, 'the fairest flower that blooms in the gardens o’ Winterfell.’

 

"Now as it happened the winter roses had only then come into bloom, and no flower is so rare nor precious. So the Stark sent to his glass gardens and commanded that the most beautiful o’ the winter roses be plucked for the singer’s payment. And so it was done. But when morning come, the singer had vanished … and so had Lord Brandon’s maiden daughter. Her bed they found empty, but for the pale blue rose that Bael had left on the pillow where her head had lain.”

 

(Jon VI -  A Clash of Kings)

Right next in the following chapter 52, Sansa has her first flowering. Thats the chapter where Sansa gets her first period and is finally fit to bear children to the king.

“The blood is the seal of your womanhood. Lady Catelyn might have prepared you. You’ve had your first flowering, no more.” Sansa had never felt less flowery. “My lady mother told me, but I… I thought it would be different.”“Different how?”“I don’t know. Less… less messy, and more magical.” Queen Cersei laughed. "Wait until you birth a child, Sansa. A woman’s life is nine parts mess to one part magic, you’ll learn that soon enough… and the parts that look like magic often turn out to be messiest of all.” She took a sip of milk. “So now you are a woman. Do you have the least idea of what that means?” “It means that I am now fit to be wedded and bedded,” said Sansa, “and to bear children for the king.” …….

Do you want to be loved, Sansa?“ "Everyone wants to be loved.” “I see flowering hasn’t made you any brighter,” said Cersei. “Sansa, permit me to share a bit of womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. Love is poison. A sweet poison, yes, but it will kill you all the same.”

(Sansa IV - A Clash of Kings)

In the end of chapter Cersei warns Sansa about love and how dangerous it can be. The following chapter of the book is also JON VII. George really wanted us to picture Jon, Sansa and the Blue Winter Rose tale all together.

blog.name: mimi0108
blog.title: Mimi0108
blog.description: I feed on cinema, tv shows, books, animals, history, music, travel, photography and especially laughter.

summary: Sansa must end happy and marry a man she loves, whom the viewers will trust.
title: Sansa must end happy and marry a man she loves, whom the viewers will trust.
body:
For me, it is clear that the series did not make gravitate so many men around Sansa to she ends up alone.

The girl who has always dreamed of love and children knew only disillusionment, torment and violence. There was no point in bringing Sansa to a wedding with Ramsay if it was not to tell how one can survive such an ordeal. And I refuse to believe that she could marry someone that the viewers does not know. After seeing the real faces of the men with whom she has been, she can no longer trust so easily. Sansa has become too independent. Even if she longs for a married life, I’m sure she’d rather be alone than marry someone she does not like or know. The series must not only convince Sansa but the audience that the man she will marry will be trustworthy and make her happy.

Sansa dreamed of being queen, falling in love and having children. The show broke her dreams. These are the two majors points of her story: to teach her what it really means to rule and what it means to be with a man. She saw the cruelty, egoism and treachery of the rulers but also the cowardice, the violence and the lack of loyalty of the subjects. She finded out that men have sometimes unhealthy’s desires, that some enjoy to hurt women, that everything does not happen as in the stories and that even if someone loves her it does not mean that he will put her interests before his, like Littlefinger did. It must be that ALL that ends somewhere. She was supposed to become queen and marry a prince. She was taught what it meant. And now, she finally understands. It is necessary that the season 8 brings her to really love someone and regained confidence in her and in men. She must end up in a position of power and happy in her love life. This is the purpose of her story.

The problem is that there are not many honest young men left. She can not be again with Tyrion as some people think. This would be a constant reminder of what she experienced at King’s Landing. Not to mention the fact that she deserves better than a man like him. I’m not saying that Tyrion is not good, only that he is too old, likes sex too much and drinks too much. Even if he was nice to her, they will not be able to really love each other. And she will not marry a man by political calculation either (she has already done it and it went wrong). So all that’s left is Gendry and Jon. But Gendry has never been a noble. He has always lived in poor neighborhoods and, although he is very nice, may not be in his place with a castle life and with a wife who holds power. So I find it hard to see how their relationship could work. But if the showrunners do it well, why not.

Let’s recap (to understand why she deserves a happy ending) :

She was betrothed to Joffrey who turned out to be a psychopath.

Then secretly engaged to Loras, whose homosexuality she did not know. He would never have brought her the love she was looking for.

Then, Sansa was forcibly married to a member of the family who held her as hostage. A man of double her age, a dwarf, a drunkard who spent his time with prostitutes (even if it is no longer the case).

Afterwards, she is betrothed to her young cousin who is still a child and with serious mental problems.

And Sansa ends up marrying the worst sadist of the show.

Not to mention that she aroused the interest of the Hound who frightened her, even though she learned to see his good side (especially since he saved her several times).

And finally, she has been Littlefinger’s loving interest for many years and has managed to escape him hold by killing him.

body:
Evil Sansa

Is there a story out there with sansa just being a crazy redhead and Sandor just losing his mind for her? Almost like a Sansa body but Ayra personality?

summary: Don’t forget to send your giftee some Anon Love!
title: Don’t forget to send your giftee some Anon Love!
body: I know there are still a few people that don’t have there Asks open, but to everyone else try to send a little something. It could anything from a quick hello, to asking what their favorite childhood Christmas memory was!

summary:
“
She has never met Oberyn and likely never will, but she is free to 
imagine him, to think that he might ride into King's...
caption:
“ She has never met Oberyn and likely never will, but she is free to imagine him, to think that he might ride into King’s Landing on a Dornish sand steed and save her. More foolish dreams for a foolish girl.”

“ The gods may have their plans, but he has his, and woe betide anyone, or any force, that stands in his way.”

Quotes & inspiration from the beautiful fanfic: The gods and their tricks by @framboise-fics

Read it here: https://archiveofourown.org/works/12951210

blog.name: thequeenofhades
blog.title: "...then I wake up, like a thief of dreams."
blog.description: Elizabeth. 33. Writer. We are stardust my darling, we have galaxies in our hearts.

title: 6SS: SanSan - Marriage
body:
Their marriage had not been a victory march.

It had been fought and raged against, but she had stood firm; she had come to love this man more than anything and he loved her back.

Only her brothers and sister had backed her, because they knew and understood the position she was coming from; she didn’t trust anyone to not want her inheritance (even now that her two brothers were back) over her.

Sandor was a hard man to like for many, he was harsh and honest, never mincing his words on things, she liked that, she had had enough of lies and deceit for a lifetime.

She wanted honesty, she wanted to be wanted for herself, she wanted freedom and that is something Sandor offered so completely and without reserve that she knew she’d be safe with him.

And as he placed his cloak around her shoulders with slightly trembling hands, she knew, that whatever the future held, they would face it together.

title: The Wolf and The Hound
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2FeIqpZ

by NiaLavellanClegane

Sansa Stark is a promising Ballerina, until a blast from her past tears it away from her. The man that murdered her mother when she was ten is back and she just watched him kill someone else.

Words: 534, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Sandor Clegane, Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Robb Stark, Jon Snow, Jon “The Smalljon” Umber, Hother “Whoresbane” Umber, Rickon Stark, Bran Stark, Direwolf | Direwolves, Shireen Baratheon, Margaery Tyrell, Loras Tyrell, Myrcella Baratheon, Gregor Clegane
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Talisa Maegyr/Robb Stark, Jon Snow/Ygritte
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Crimes & Criminals, Ballet, Dark Sansa, Fluff and Smut, Angst and Tragedy, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder - PTSD, Other Additional Tags to Be Added


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2FeIqpZ
